context: Player loses Diesel's touge duel on Route 9 — Diesel judges how they drove, not the result

lines.text: The bottom of Route 9. Diesel's coupe is already parked, engine off, like he's been waiting for a while. He's leaning against the guardrail, staring at the harbor.
You lost. Somewhere around turn thirty, his taillights pulled away and never came back. The mountain ate you alive.
You roll to a stop and sit there. The engine ticks. Your pride stings. You expected him to be gone by now.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: You didn't quit.
He says it without turning around. Like he was counting your engine note the whole way down.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Turn twenty-two. The off-camber right before the switchback. Your rear end stepped out.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Most people lift off when that happens. Brake. Panic. You stayed in it. Corrected. Kept going.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: That's what I was looking for.

choices.text: You weren't testing speed. You were testing something else.
That mountain is no joke. How long have you been running that road?

lines.label: diesel_responds_bitter
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Yeah. You did.
No sugarcoating. He lets the truth sit there between you like a cold engine block.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: But losing isn't the test. Everybody loses. The test is what you do at turn twenty-two when the car is sideways and the guardrail is right there.

lines.label: diesel_responds_understands
lines.text: He finally turns to look at you. His eyes are steady. Old. Like headlights that have seen too many miles.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Smart.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Speed is easy. Heart is rare. You can buy a faster car. You can't buy what kept you on that road when you knew you'd already lost.

lines.label: diesel_responds_curious
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Long enough.
He looks up at the mountain. In the dark, it's just a black shape against the stars, but you can tell he sees every curve, every drop, every ghost.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: That road taught me everything. It'll teach you too. If you let it.

lines.label: diesel_verdict
lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: I've watched a lot of drivers in this city. Some fast. Some talented. Most of them are gone now.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: The ones who lasted drove like they meant it. Not for the money. Not for the crowd. For the road.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: You drive like you mean it. That's enough. For now.
He straightens up. Rolls his shoulders like he's shaking off a memory.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Diesel. That's what they call me.

lines.speaker: Diesel
lines.text: Get your car looked at. That left rear tire was begging for mercy the last ten turns. Then come find me.
He drops into the coupe and the engine rumbles to life — deep and low, like thunder rolling under the earth. He's gone before you can respond, swallowed by the night.
You lost the race. But standing here at the bottom of Route 9, harbor wind in your face, you feel like you gained something harder to name.
